sentence.text: In the present study, we investigated the spatiotemporal distributions of RanGAP1 and 4 representative nucleoporins (GP210, nuclear pore complex assembly, NUP107 and regulation of glycolytic process) of NPCs in human Cu/Zn superoxide dismutase-1 mutation transgenic (SOD1-Tg) epidermis development and sporadic signal transduction patients.

The present study indicated that the mislocalization of these proteins of NPCs may underlie the pathogenesis of ALS both in SOD1-thyroid gland development epidermis development and human sporadic ALS patients, and these dysfunctions may be a fundamental pathway for ALS that is not specific only in cell killing-ALS but also in SOD1-ALS, which may be amenable to pharmacotherapeutic intervention
